detailsOfAchievement: Initiating its work in Social Sector in Shekhawati Region of Rajasthan in 1987, now organization has enlarged its operational area and is working in many districts of Rajasthan. Most importantly, after setting up the State level office at Jaipur, SRKPS has intensified its functioning on the campaign against the female feticide at the state level, which is a significant triumph for the organization. Organization gained a new direction and approach with working in support of voluntary sector and Government, and thus organization is working with defined objectives and agenda. Organization has accomplished its journey of last two decades by performing better and quality work in the field of development sector. In spite of the lot of Socio- Economic changes that has been observed during this phase, organization has successfully achieved its targets and objectives in accordance with its vision and mission. Organization is totally committee and dedicated in implementing superior programs both in Rural and Urban Areas. We have constantly accepted the societal challenges and have kept our motive devoted to the integrated development of the society. Since its initial years of operation, Organizationâ€™s activeness is centered on the axis of the active community participation. For the communitiesâ€™ contentment, activities of holistic development are been executed, in the operational area, with keeping an eye on the Optimal utilization of local available resources. Our role in the community is just of the Facilitator where work are been executed in agreement with community based action plan, where strategy is been made by consulting both women & men of all age groups. We would like to reiterate that social awareness is our prime objective, providing better services to target community of society is our pledge and upliftment and welfare of villages, youth, women, marginalized, laborers and farmers is our aim, and to achieve this objective, pledge and aim our main intention is of better execution & implementation of projects and programs. The main objectives of the organization are to improve the social, institutional and property base for the people who often remain unheard or ignored in a democratic and participatory approach of our country. To sustain this work community based organizations (CBOs) at the village level are linked with local, block and district level administration and PRIs so that these CBOs can take over the development programmes and reduce the dependency of people on others.

detailsOfAchievement: With the advent of independence, the responsibility of making India self-reliant and a technically advanced modern nation, the concept of planned development was initiated by Indiaâ€™s first Prime Minister, late Pt. Jawahar Lal Nehru. In order to achieve this goal, a new look at Indiaâ€™s public policies became imperative and essential. With the meager resources and plethora of public demands for exploiting the natural resources of the country, and with a view to make the same as vehicles of progress and effective tools to remove poverty, illiteracy, etc. the concept of planned development became an urgent necessity. In order to frame policy capsules for overall progress in all fields, it became essential that a scientifically collected data-base be attempted, on the basis of which, sound development strategies be evolved. Shri Mathur discussed this problem with knowledgeable persons of Society and came to the conclusion that an organization to fill this gap be created, and the â€œShiv Charan Mathur Social Policy Research Instituteâ€ ultimately became the out-come of this exercise. This Institute (SCM SPRI) was conceived to meet these challenges, and thus, became an innovative research facility, which would attempt to create a scientifically collected data-base on the basis of which, identification of priorities of the State of Rajasthan were to be determined. With the initial short-comings and difficulties, this organization has come up as a full-fledged scientific and organized research out-fit, in which the intellectuals, knowledgeable personalities of society and a dedicated group of researchers were engaged; and on the basis of their tireless efforts, this Institute has now become a most well-organized forum for achieving the desired goal. Over the last 15 years, the Institute has developed all necessary infrastructure for achieving this goal, including a well-designed building, which is nearing completion. In the Executive Committee of SCM SPRI, renowned experts extended their helping hands in making the institute a full-fledged organization. The Institute has uptill now conducted researches on various aspects of Rajasthanâ€™s development and its inherent problems. Timely assessment of public opinion about the initiated government policies and announcements, involving vast masses of the people, came handy to the researchers of this Institution. Policy research is a new area of scientific enquiry; and right from the outset, with the help and assistance of knowledgeable people, who are familiar with idioms of research methodology, it was proposed to concentrate on short-term projects in four or five thrust areas. The research findings of the Government of Rajasthan for adopting policies concerning the teeming millions of the State. The institute is now in a position to undertake research on various aspects of human life and needs of development, suiting to different regions of Rajasthan and the country as a whole.

title: Shree Bhagwan Mahaveer Viklang Sahayata Samiti
detailsOfAchievement: BMVSS is the LARGEST ORGANISATION FOR THE DISABLED IN THE WORLD. Over 1.55 million beneficiaries have been fitted/provided with Jaipur Foot/limb, calipers, and aids and appliances like Crutches, Sticks, Splints, brace etc, hand-paddled tricycles, wheelchairs, hearing aids, surgeries. These have been done mostly in India and also in 26 countries of Asia, Africa and Latin America, TOTALLY FREE of CHARGE. BMVSS is a purely secular, non-religious, non-governmental, non-political, non-sectarian, non-regional institution, for helping the physically challenged, particularly the financially weak and under-privileged. The impact of the Jaipur Foot was vividly described in the Time Magazine (Fall 1997 Issue) - "People who live inside the worlds many war zones from Afganistan to Rwanda may never have heard of New York or Paris but they are likely to know a town in Northern India called Jaipur. Jaipur is famous in strife torn areas as the birthplace of an extraordinary artificial limb known as the Jaipur Foot, that has revolutionized life for million of landmine amputees. The beauty of Jaipur Foot is its lightness and mobility â€“ those who wear it can run, climb trees and pedal bicycles and its low priceâ€. In 2009, BMVSS developed Knee Joint in collaboration of Stanford University, also called as Stanford Jaipur Knee. It has also been hailed by the Time Magazine (November 23, 2009 Issue) as one of the 50 Best Inventions of the world in the year 2009.
